comments:
Problem seems to be that  org.eclipse.wst.common.uriresolver plugin is till 
eclipse 3.0 style and has a hard depencency on org.eclipse.core.runtime and 
there fore  on platform.ide.

John please take a look, I actually don't understand this defect, and don't
think we should be changing this for M8.

Lawrence, can you take a look here?  According to Jason, he has talked with you
about this.

I hit this bug when trying to fix 109758.  This runs OK in a regular workbench,
but fails in a scaled down workbench running headlessly.

Since not fixed in M8, moving target to "unspecified". Please update 
as progress is made.

As per 9/29 status meeting, this is not longer considered blocking. 
If I've misunderstood, please update.

Hey Lawrence, if have dropped the code to cvs which we sent to Bala last week, I
think you can go ahead and close this.

There was no hard dependency on platform.ide. The dependency on core.runtime is
allowed. 

The problem was the plugin class's constructor required a super() call. This
call does not seem to affect plugin initialization when running with the Eclipse
IDE but does prevent the plugin from loading when running headlessly.

Fixed. Please verify with a build from 20051001 or later.

Created an attachment (id=27736)
Fix for URI resolver plugin

Created an attachment (id=27737)
Corrected patch for URI resolver

This is the correct, simple patch for the URI resolver. The previous patch
contained other fixes.
